thread.title: Human Ken Doll reveals despair over giant cyst | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Human Ken Doll reveals despair over giant cyst | Daily Mail Online

author: Rebecca Davison For Mailonline
title: Human Ken Doll reveals despair over giant cyst | Daily Mail Online
text: Share Shock: The cyst (pictured) isn't dangerous 'I went to the doctor and he told me that it would have always been there but my facelift has made it much bigger. 'It doesn't hurt and I went to the doctor and he confirmed it was not dangerous, but I need to get it removed. I can't wait for the NHS. 'Day by day, it gets bigger so on 19th, I am off to Los Angeles to carry on filming my show and then I will get it removed.' He told MailOnline: 'I posted a Snapchat and Instagram story about the making of my new reality show and everyone noticed it and I don't know how I missed it' He continued: 'I went to the doctor and he told me that it would have always been there but my facelift has made it much bigger. I need to get it removed before the Oscars party' Rodrigo also said he will be getting another procedure while away in the US. He said: 'I'm having a deep co2 Skin resurfacing on sedation with facial plastic surgeon Dr Payman Simoni who will clear all the scars and open pores on my face. 'He will give me the flawless dolly skin that I have always wanted to have and at the same time Dr Simoni will remove this ugly and unwanted cyst. Before and after: As a young man in Brazil, Rodrigo became unhappy with his looks and has since spent over £368,000 in achieving his 'perfect' appearance Surgery mad: Rodrigo Alves has dismissed claims he's gone too far with extreme procedures, insisting during his appearance on Friday's installment of This Morning that he was free to stop at any time - even though he has no plans to 'On the 26th I'm attending Elton John Oscars Party after the award ceremony and I must look at the best on that day without lumps. 'I also hope that I won’t be so swollen by then. What can I say? It's hard work being beautiful.' His latest worry comes after Rodrigo appeared on Friday's installment of This Morning, in which he denied he is addicted to cosmetic procedures. He said: 'There's no such thing as being addicted to plastic surgery', he told concerned hosts Ruth Langsford and Eamonn Holmes. 'It's constant, it's like getting an MOT on a car.' Seeking perfection: 'Plastic surgery made me the person I am today,' he boldly claimed. 'I want to be the best person I can with the help of plastic surgery' Painful: He exclusively told MailOnline he has been having a testing time as he recovers from 'the worst surgery of his life ' - pictured after removing the bandages following the op Ouch: Rodrigo shared a picture of himself following his 50th cosmetic procedure which showed his face swollen and bruised Rodrigo said: 'Most of us try and change ourselves somehow, I took it to a different level. I'm a different person, now my soul matches my body!' 'Plastic surgery made me the person I am today,' he boldly claimed. 'I want to be the best person I can with the help of plastic surgery.' Quizzed about how he manages to pay for so many expensive procedures, the star insisted he is paying out of his own pocket, using his inheritance. Doing his thing: Rodrigo recently received an award from Dr Andrew Ordon in LA for his 'power and courage to reinvent himself with the help of plastic surgery' Share or comment on this article Most watched News videos
